Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly early patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; exterior: mostly reserved with trace of brown; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Wheelmarks and text demonstrate that there was some form of decoration above the graffito, and so this was not a plain chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0270) (phase 2)
